title: COVID-19 Email Update | Boston Medical Center
description: Thank you for continuing to choose Boston Medical Center for your care! Please see below for some important information and updates about COVID-19.
cleaned_text: Thank you for continuing to choose Boston Medical Center for your care! Please see below for some important information and updates about COVID-19. You can also always find information about COVID-19 testing, vaccines, treatment, and more on [BMC.org](https://www.bmc.org/covid-19). Get Free At-Home COVID-19 Tests Did you know that each household in the United States can get four free rapid COVID-19 tests mailed directly to their home? Testing for COVID-19 at home is a great way to help you make decisions for your health, whether you have symptoms of COVID-19 or just want peace of mind. To order: [Place your order online with USPS](https://special.usps.com/testkits)and tests will ship when they become available. - Call 1-800-232-0233 between 8 a.m. and midnight, seven days a week to order by phone. Both private insurance companies and the MassHealth pharmacy benefit will also cover over-the-counter at-home rapid COVID-19 tests. Up to eight tests a month are covered without the need for a prescription. Please contact your insurance company to learn more about how these tests are covered. In some cases, you may need to send a receipt to your insurer after buying the test yourself to get money back. [Learn more about free COVID-19 tests from USPS](https://faq.usps.com/s/article/At-Home-COVID-19-Test-Kits). COVID-19 Treatment at BMC BMC now has several treatments available for mild and moderate COVID-19. These treatments can keep you from getting very sick from COVID-19. If you have COVID-19 and are at high risk of developing severe COVID or are unvaccinated, please talk to your doctor to learn more and see if you're eligible for treatment. [Learn more about COVID-19 treatment](https://www.bmc.org/covid-19/frequently-asked-questions). COVID-19 Vaccines Still Available Getting vaccinated - and getting your booster dose if you've already been vaccinated - is the best way to protect yourself and those around you from COVID-19. Boston Medical Center is offering first, second, third, and booster doses of COVID-19 vaccines to individuals of all ages. Vaccines are available on BMC's campus and at community vaccination sites. You can [book an appointment for a vaccination on BMC.org](https://www.bmc.org/covid-19-vaccine-locations), or just walk in to get vaccinated.
